body_html:
I download the *.whl file from pytorch.org,and installed it with，i can execute'import torch' OK，but i git the same error when i ececute x = torch.rand(5,3),i can't solve it until i has read this issue.
at last, it's working ok,below is the procese:

  1. clone the code with git
  2. execute sudo python3 setpu.py install
  3. when i execute 'import torch',i got GOMP error,how to do next?
  4. execute sudo pip3 uninstall torch
  5. execute command as 2th.
  6. every thing is ok.

PS: OS is ubuntu 16.04 LTS, AMD CPU

I hope my experience could help other who got the same error.
tow tips:

  1. uninstall the old installation with pip (if not uninstall , maybe you will got GOMP error)
  2. install from source with setup.py

I download the *.whl file from pytorch.org,and installed it with，i can execute'import torch' OK，but i git the same error when i ececute x = torch.rand(5,3),i can't solve it until i has read this issue.
at last, it's working ok,below is the procese:

clone the code with git
execute sudo python3 setpu.py install
when i execute 'import torch',i got GOMP error,how to do next?
execute sudo pip3 uninstall torch
execute command as 2th.
every thing is ok.

PS: OS is ubuntu 16.04 LTS, AMD CPU
I hope my experience could help other who got the same error.
tow tips:

uninstall the old installation with pip (if not uninstall , maybe you will got GOMP error)
install from source with setup.py
body:
I download the *.whl file from pytorch.org,and installed it with，i can execute'import torch' OK，but i git the same error when i ececute `x = torch.rand(5,3)`,i can't solve it until i has read this issue.
at last, it's working ok,below is the procese:
1. clone the code with git
2. execute `sudo python3 setpu.py install`
3. when i execute 'import torch',i got GOMP error,how to do next?
4. execute `sudo pip3 uninstall torch`
5. execute command as 2th.
6. every thing is ok.

PS: OS is ubuntu 16.04 LTS, AMD CPU

I hope my experience could help other who got the same error.
tow tips:
1. uninstall the old installation with pip (if not uninstall , maybe you will got GOMP error)
2. install from source with setup.py
